They are pulled upright and ordered to run. Terrified, they do. The MERCENARIES watch the brutal sight.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Can’t we do something?!

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS
dialogues.text: What happens when those ass holes don’t come back?

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Something has -  61.

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS
dialogues.text: (grabbing his face) - Shut up! The PRISONERS are running for their lives. Their eyes bulge in terror knowing each step could be their last. The murky water splashes up into their faces as they reach the middle of the RICE PADDY. The SOLDIERS loudly goad them on. Gliding stealthfully through the tree line, RAMBO focuses on the soldiers as though he were a lion, and they, intended prey. ARTHUR and the MERCENARIES watch this drama unfolding. Miraculously, the KAREN PRISONERS arrive at the OPPOSITE side of the lethal rice paddy. Exhausted, they are barely able to breathe. RAMBO has moved within killing range. The SOLDIER angrily pays off a bet - Then loudly insists on making another bet. Once done the SOLDIERS yell for The RACERS to rise and run back the other way. The SOLDIERS fire shots and one KAREN PRISONER weakly musters the strength to defiantly face the infuriated soldiers. He drops to the muddy ground and begins to pray. Without removing his eyes from the intended target, RAMBO places the arrow on the taunt bow string and slowly draws it back. The incensed SOLDIER jams the muzzle of his rifle against the prisoner’s head and prepares to pull the trigger Suddenly a HISSING SOUND is heard and a black ARROW penetrates the soldier's back and protrudes from his chest. The SECOND SOLDIER is attempting to un-shoulder his rifle when another arrow fatally buries itself through his body. The THIRD soldier is almost killed simultaneously. The FOURTH SOLDIER tries to get to his rifle, but can’t and runs. RAMBO buries an arrow in his back. The soldier staggers forward and steps into the rice paddy. With his last dying breath he turns and curses RAMBO, who lets another arrow go, which sinks into the defiant soldier’s chest. He falls forward and collapses on a LAND MINE. His  88 shattered body is blown upwards then crashes to the mud@y earth. The stunned MERCENARIES rise from their cover. LEWIS (CONT’D) (re: Rambo) What the fuck was that? ARTHUR steps out into the open, aghast at what he’s witnessed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAMBO’S removing the arrows from the soldier’s body as the mercenaries dash over.

dialogues.speaker: REESE
dialogues.text: Yeah, who the fuck are you? He ignores LEWIS and the awe struck mercenaries and addresses the KAREN GUIDE.

dialogues.speaker: RAMBO
dialogues.text: (in Thai) How long before they go missing?

dialogues.speaker: KAREN GUIDE
dialogues.text: (in Thai) Three hours - four hours.

dialogues.speaker: REESE
dialogues.text: Where’d you learn that shit?

dialogues.speaker: RAMBO
dialogues.text: You’re ready to move?

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS
dialogues.text: “Move!?” Move to what?

dialogues.speaker: REESE
dialogues.text: (to bodies) When these motherfuckers don’t show up they’re gonna hunt our asses down an’ we’re gonna be layin’ down here all fucked up - I don’t know about nobody else, but I got family, I got people worth stayin’ alive for, that need my ass. 88 + ee RO  63.

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS
dialogues.text: We’re done - We’re outta here, let’s get back to the boat, let’s go!! C’mon, we don’t need this shit -

dialogues.speaker: RAMBO
dialogues.text: If you take a man’s money, a good man keeps his word.

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS
dialogues.text: ‘Good man?’ Keep fuckin’ with me, I swear on my kid’s eyes, I’11 kill ya! RAMBO draws back his bow. The arrow tip is inches from LEWIS’ face. LEWIS (CONT’D) What you doin,’ man? What ya doin’?

dialogues.speaker: RAMBO
dialogues.text: Ever kill anything up close? Ever kill anything at all?

dialogues.speaker: SCHOOL BOY
dialogues.text: Anyone who leaves is gutless, we’ve been in deep before. (faces Rambo) I’m in. RAMBO lowers the bow and moves towards the Karen prisoners. SCHOOL BOY (CONT’D) So what’s your call?

dialogues.speaker: RAMBO
dialogues.text: We’re gettin’ into that compound.

dialogues.speaker: SCHOOL BOY
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: RAMBO
dialogues.text: (gestures to the dead soldiers) ...Strip ‘em and sink ‘em. RAMBO and SCHOOL BOY go to the fallen soldiers and begin to unbutton their uniforms ...After a moment of contemplation REESE steps forward to help DIAZ followed by EN-JOO. LEWIS starts to walk away, reconsiders then reluctantly approaches the other mercenaries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several shots showing the intimidating misty landscape. Jungle sounds fill the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Situated in a clearing in the forest is an Army compound of sorts. It’s not your normal compound. It’s more of a BIVOUAC area with tents and LARGE

dialogues.speaker: THATCHED HUTS, GUARDED BAMBOO CAGES. KAREN
dialogues.text: PRISONERS reside in several of these cages. EXT. - MAJOR TINT’S RESIDENCE - NIGHT 91 This is a LARGE HUT with a small bamboo cage several feet from its entrance. The few lights seen are mostly KEROSENE operated and the electric lights for the guard tower are lit by an antique GENERATOR. In the BAMBOO CAGE beside TINT'S hut is SARAH. She appears drawn and absolutely spiritless. Her face reveals bruising. A pair of listless GUARDS smoke cigarettes and chat in front of another cage holding SEVERAL more FEMALE KAREN PRISONERS... A disheveled GUARD approaches, dragging a physically exhausted YOUNG KAREN WOMAN. He opens the cage and heaves her in. One of the SEATED GUARDS flicks his cigarette at the woman, then grabs another young KAREN WOMEN from the cage. She pleads for mercy. The soldier roughly seizes her and shoves her into a shadowy hut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Headlights belonging to the MILITARY TRUCK cut through hazy darkness. It pauses at the COMPOUND’S entrance. A SINGLE GUARD lazily steps forward and waves the truck through.  93 94 95 96 65. MYINT, the KAREN GUIDE and one of the KAREN PRISONERS are in the front seats of the truck They are wearing the DEAD SOLDIERS’ uniforms. In the rear bed of the truck are RAMBO and the MERCENARIES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watching from a nearby elevated outcropping is ARTHUR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mercenaries CAMOUFLAGED PAINTED FACES drift in and out of the shadows as the truck travels deeper into the compound. As the vehicle slowly rumbles long, the MERCENARIES drop out ONE by ONE and immediately duck into protective areas. The men spread out and begin searching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARTHUR observes the headlights of the truck down below. He can barely hide his mounting anxiety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DIAZ peers through the bamboo bars of an empty cage and studies a guard passing by. LEWIS and REESE dash behind a THATCHED HUT. Their alert eyes searching for the missionaries. RAMBO sees faint light emanating through the slats of the hootch. He gazes inside. A soldier is reading. By the glow of a small LANTERN inside a BAMBOO HOOTCH, DIAZ sees THREE SOLDIERS playing a card game. One of the soldiers is no more than 15 YEARS OLD...DIAZ moves away. LEWIS and REESE arrive at the cage occupied by four KAREN WOMEN.  97 98 99 66. In the moonlight RAMBO sees the outline of a MAN propped up ON A THICK BAMBOO POLE like a scarecrow in a pig pen. Several PIGS grunt as they congregate at the base of the pole situated in the center of the pen. Staring into the darkness RAMBO sees the bottom half of a man that has been MUTILATED and partially eaten. The dead Man is MICHAEL BURNETT, the head American missionary. SCHOOL BOY dodges a pair of young soldiers leading a terrified woman into a hootch... Jumping back, he sinks to his knees and spots several pairs of dead men’s feet lined up in a row. RAMBO moves away to the pig pen towards TINT'S hut. SCHOOL BOY crawls to the trio of dead men. We see the deceased faces of THREE MALE MISSIONARIES. Their THROATS have been cut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARTHUR attempts to move closer to improve his visual vantage point. He stumbles forward and tumbles onto a sharpened row of PUNJI STICKS hidden in the undergrowth that buries itself deeply into his thigh. He nearly yells out in pain, but instinctively cups a hand over his mouth. Upon closer inspection, we see there are numerous PUNJI STICKS lined up like a deadly picket fence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The GUARD nearest the sound of ARTHUR’S muffled cry, freezes. He waits to hear more. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAMBO approaches TINT’S lodging. TINT watches a V.H.S. show (subtitled episode of “Miami Vice”) on a twenty-year old T.V. He DRINKS and SMOKES. +e eH OF  100 101 102 67. Two OFFICERS in their T-shirts sit nearby also watching the show.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Lies curled in the bamboo ‘Tiger Cage.’ The ambient light from the hut reveals her facial contours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARTHUR takes off his belt and attempts to stem the flow of blood from the nasty wound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The GUARD is on full alert as he strains to hear. A SECOND GUARD approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don’t know - The SECOND GUARD, who is in fact MYINT, the KAREN GUIDE, moves beside him and striking with the speed of a snake, covers the #1 Guard’s mouth while simultaneously plunging a knife into his heart. Lowering the dead guard, MYINT goes to the imprisoned women and open their cage. The KAREN GUIDE looks around for the other mercenaries, seeing none, he follows the women. They angle their tiny bodies through the punji stick fence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARTHUR has stemmed the blood flow with his belt. Though in agonizing pain he manages to rise as he observes the dark compound below.  103 104 105 68.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCHOOL BOY meets up with LEWIS and REESE.

dialogues.speaker: SCHOOL BOY
dialogues.text: (gesturing) Found three dead white guys -

dialogues.speaker: REESE
dialogues.text: That’s them -

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS
dialogues.text: we’re out of here -

dialogues.speaker: SCHOOL BOY
dialogues.text: - What about the others? REESE moves off with LEWIS, leaving SCHOOL BOY hanging in mid-sentence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAMBO moves to the hootch belonging to TINT. He spots what could be SARAH curled in a bamboo cage. He studies her sleeping face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EN-JOO is concealed behind a hut when he notices LEWIS and REESE moving cautiously towards the entrance. He follows. LEWIS and REESE creep up on the half-dozing gate guard. They glance up at the GUARD TOWER, which is dark except for the outline of a guard. A red ember glows from his cigarette. They see EN-JOO and motion to him. With deadly calm EN-JOO stalks the guard then strangles him with a garotte. As the guard struggles for his life, EN-J0O drags him to the ground. LEWIS, REESE and EN-JOO take this opportunity to make their escape. LEWIS motions like he’s going to follow after REESE and EN-JOO, but has a change of heart and back tracks into the compound. REESE and EN-JOO are stunned by this, but continue to beat a hasty retreat. + ee OF  106 107 108 109 110 141 69. The GATE guard’s replacement, listlessly prepares to take up his watch. He calls out for his fellow soldier. No response...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EN-JOO and REESE hoof it to the crest and bolt into the jungle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BURMESE GUARD flicks on a flashlight and scans the empty cages and raises a WHISTLE to his lips.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. - COMPOUND - SARAH’S CAGE 108 RAMBO is about to open the cage when the whistle jolts him upright. SARAH stirs in the cage. Opening her eyes, RAMBO is gone. INT./EXT. - COMPOUND - TINT’S HUT 109 The shrill blast is strong enough to hear over the tape playing in TINT'S hootch. He and his fellow officer rise. EXT. - COMPOUND - TINT’S HUT 110 RAMBO stands in the shadow behind TINT’S hut, as the men charge out the front entrance. The SOLDIERS emerge weapons drawn. They stand riveted to the voice of TINT who yells for a status report. One SOLDIER rushes forward bellowing that prisoners are missing and a guard is dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCHOOL BOY ducks in the shadows. The compound is alive with angry troops.  112 He attempts to angle past the punji stick fence. 70. He succeeds and barrels up the hill into the jungle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCHOOL BOY rushes toward the locale where ARTHUR remains half hidden. As SCHOOL BOY approaches a terrified ARTHUR nearly jumps from the concealment. Wired, SCHOOL BOY almost mistakenly shoots him.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Find anyone?!

dialogues.speaker: SCHOOL BOY
dialogues.text: They’re all dead -

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: - They can’t be.

dialogues.speaker: SCHOOL BOY
dialogues.text: - C’mon, we gotta move!

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Maybe you’re wrong - Where’s everyone else!?

dialogues.speaker: SCHOOL BOY
dialogues.text: They’re dead! - Let’s go!! (he pulls at Arthur)

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: (pulls free) You could be wrong!!

dialogues.speaker: SCHOOL BOY
dialogues.text: (powerfully seizes his shirt) I’m not wrong; lets’s go! ARTHUR struggles violently and they both tumble. SCHOOL BOY pins him. SCHOOL BOY (CONT’D) They’re god damn dead! ARTHUR again struggles with all his might and SCHOOL BOY releases him.  113 114 115 116 71.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: (rising) * You could be wrong! You have to be * wrong! * SCHOOL BOY realizes it’s hopeless and takes off. *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DIAZ attempts to make an escape from the back of the compound. A TOWER GUARD’S light nearly catches him in its beam. Troops are rushing from both sides, but DIAZ escapes detection by diving under the huts. Fourty-five SOLDIERS, armed with weapons and hand- * held lights, pour out of the gates. TWENTY other soldiers pile into the truck. RAMBO, hidden beneath a hut observes this and calculates his next move. TINT climbs into an open-top Army vehicle. On the back is a .50 Cal. Machine gun. The vehicle speeds away . The TRUCK is approaching the gate, RAMBO seizes the exact Moment to roll from under the HUT, and duck into the shadows. Bouncing headlights from the Jeep and army transport truck are seen passing below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On higher ground, ARTHUR seeks shelter among rotted tree stumps as the troops approach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A search party of ten Burmese troops spread out and walk in a parallel line towards ARTHUR. *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two MERCENARIES rush though the jungle...  117 118 119 120 72.

dialogues.speaker: REESE
dialogues.text: This way!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TROOP TRUCK continues to drop off TROOPS who chase after the panicked mercenaries. A pair of SEARCH DOGS and their HANDLERS also jump down from the troop truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The KAREN WOMEN PRISONERS are running as fast as they can up the shore of the shallow stream. THREE SOLDIERS appear and see them. They aim their weapons. * Suddenly MYINT appears from behind a tree and cuts the * unsuspecting SOLDIERS down. Once done he sprints after * the women. *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARTHUR fights his tremors while curled beneath rotting logs. The stalking GUARDS quickly move past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two MERCENARIES are ripping through the lower level growth near the rice paddy. From several hundred yards behind them two RED FLARES burst high in the air turning the area crimson. Enemy shots ring out and TRACERS pierce the night. The MERCENARIES flee toward the foliage at the other side of the RICE PADDY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they continue to flee, EN-JOO falls into a PIT-TRAP that is loaded with deadly PUNJI STICKS. He screams in agony. REESE has to make a life or death decision. He reaches down into the pit where EN-JOO’S legs and feet have been impaled. +e ee OF

dialogues.speaker: EN-JOO
dialogues.text: Go - Go - Save yourself! x  124 122 123 124 They sprint off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pair of agitated guards continues to comb the area around the empty tiger cages. As the beam of the GUARD’S flashlight moves past RAMBO’S fleeting image is seen passing behind him;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DIAZ is suspended in the support beams beneath a hut. After a Burmese soldier flashes his light underneath the hut, DIAZ drops down and plots his next move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A backlit image of a guard moves past TINT'S hut. He flashes his beam into the bamboo cage that has been situated directly beside TINT'S hut. The beam reveals SARAH.

124 122 123 124 The marshy bank on the opposite side of the rice paddies appears calm as the rushing TROOPERS prepare to enter. A light FOG obscures the view. Suddenly a GRENADE is tossed at the SOLDIERS. It erupts and two are blasted away. Situated on a 90 degree angle, REESE and EN-JOO on his bleeding knees, unleash a tremendous amount of fire power and FOUR TROOPS are killed. TEN SOLDIERS fire back and unleash a tremendous amount of fire power. TRACER FIRE lights up the horrible carnage. In the first two seconds EN-JOO is hit. REESE fires back with his grenade gun. REESE gets hit in the neck, then in the body. Wailing in agony, he fires back. x ee RO  125 126 127 128 129 74. Bellowing like an enraged beast, EN-JOO tries to rise to one knee, firing wildly until enemy bullets riddle his flesh. REESE is dying but, in a valiant effort, rises to one knee, and pulls the pin on a grenade, but it slips from his bloody hand and he collapses on top of the explosive which blows his body several feet in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAMBO slides up to a stack of fifty hundred-gallon drums of gasoline. He opens the tap on several of them, then slips away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LEWIS is seen moving along the inside of the compound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Creeping through the shadows, RAMBO flips back a canvas and reveals many cases of MUNITIONS, C-4 EXPLOSIVES, AND GRENADES. He quickly slips grenades into his fatigue pockets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TROOPER CARRIER slows down to pick up the successful soldiers as they prepare to return to the compound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAMBO moves through the compound, slipping silently past SEVERAL GUARDS who have sought shelter from the rain beneath huts overhang. RAMBO moves past the body of MICHAEL BURNETT tied to a pole in the PIG PEN.  130 75.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SARAH nearly suffers cardiac arrest when startled by a big hand sliding between the bamboo bars and covering her mouth. She’s pulled so close she * can’t see who’s grabbed her, but feels his warm * breath beside her ear. *

dialogues.speaker: RAMBO
dialogues.text: (whispering) ...It’s alright, Sarah, it’s alright. * He gently releases her and she finds herself staring bewildered into RAMBO’S eyes. * RAMBO (CONT’D) (softly) I’1l get you out, I promise. * Opening the CAGE, he cuts the abrasive rope that binds her hands and she slumps against his chest in relief and gratitude. RAMBO hears footsteps! Knife still in hand, he jumps back and ducks beside the hut just asa soldier turns the corner. The soldier flashes his light. SARAH is caught in the dimming beam that cuts through the light rain. Just before the alert soldier moves on, he quickly turns back and notices the CAGE DOOR is AJAR. He prepares to blow his whistle when a THROWING KNIFE slices through the rain and buries itself in his chest. The soldier crumbles and RAMBO quickly drags the body beside the hut. RAMBO returns to the cage and prepares to remove the shell-shocked woman, when suddenly he is alerted by the sound of the transport truck and TINT'S vehicle traveling past swinging the gate. RAMBO (CONT’D) (whispering in her ear) ...You have to stay in there.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: (low) * ...No. Don’t go. Please don’t leave me! * Please! *  76. Confused, she tries to exit. He holds her back.

dialogues.speaker: RAMBO
dialogues.text: I won’t leave - Promise. RAMBO moves away and slides under TINT'S hootch. A second later DIAZ slides under. Startled, RAMBO nearly impales him. DIAZ belly crawls beside him. Peering out from beneath the porch, they sees SOLDIERS BOOTS tramping through the mud. RAMBO motions for him to be silent. As the truck grinds past, we see the bullet- riddled bodies of EN-JOO and REESE. RAMBO and DIAZ stare at the gruesome display. RAMBO’S eyes reveal nothing. DIAZ lowers his head into the moist earth, realizing he’s soon a dead man too. SARAH looks on in horror. Covering her eyes, she slumps to the cage floor. It passes a HUT under which LEWIS is hiding. He closes his eyes, knowing that could be his fate too. TINT’S vehicle pulls up next to his hut. He strides to the CAGE holding SARAH. Ripping open the door he snatches her hair, and slams her head up against the bamboo bars, all the while cursing in BURMESE. Though only feet away, RAMBO and DIAZ are POWERLESS to act because of the close proximity of the other soldiers. TINT yanks her from the cage and Sarah is heaved to the wretched mud. She suddenly bolts upright and flails at him. In her weakened state, she is viciously heaved to the ground. TINT and places a boot on her throat, as if to say, “where is your fucking God now?!!” RAMBO can barely contain himself. HE’S NEVER WANTED TO KILL ANYTHING SO BADLY. TINT grabs her by a HEMP ROPE around her neck and yanks her upright.  131 132 77. The splattering rain creates rivets of mud that trail down her proud features. Her expression is one of a calm resolve.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: ...You can kill the outside - only that. TINT tightens the rope and yells for two soldiers standing nearby to come forward.

dialogues.speaker: TINT
dialogues.text: (in Burmese) Yours - Take her! The TwO SOLDIERS rush forward and drag SARAH away. RAMBO and DIAZ belly-crawl under the line of huts until they arrive at the locale where Sarah is being held.

dialogues.speaker: RAMBO
dialogues.text: Cover me. SOLDIER #1 shoves SARAH onto his cot. With a growing sense of menace he pulls off his soaked shirt. The other soldier tightens the rope around her neck. SARAH still fights back. RAMBO prepares to enter and thoroughly kill them, but a RIFLE SHOT breaks the momentum. Outside, DIAZ cranes his head around the corner towards the shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LEWIS watching soldiers run past while he stays hidden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the fading rain we see a surreal vision of ARTHUR meekly stepping towards the gathering soldiers.  133 134 78.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: (softly) - I surrender - Can we talk, please? I surrender.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pulling on his shirt, SOLDIER #1 steps onto the front porch, then heads toward the commotion. #2 follows. OFFICER #2 steps back in and seeing SARAH tied on the bed, decides to take advantage of this moment He approaches the bed and stares down at SARAH, who’s terrified eyes travel from the SOLDIER to something standing behind him. He turns, it’s RAMBO. Now face to face with the ANGEL OF DEATH, the soldier doesn’t have a second to respond before the bridge of his nose is broken and shoved up into his brain. RAMBO pulls SARAH to her feet then drags the body out. The body lands near DIAZ who’s eyes are riveted on the disturbance at the FRONT GATE. RAMBO shoves the body under the hut

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forty soldiers have gathered around ARTHUR, as TINT’S right-hand man, LIEUTENANT AYE muscles through the men and GLARES at ARTHUR who is beaten to the ground by one of the troops. He is yanked to his feet by a pair of soldiers.

dialogues.speaker: LT. AYE
dialogues.text: (in Burmese) WHO ARE YOU, you son of a bitch! Where did you come from! !? LT. AYE kicks ARTHUR’S legs out from under him. The minister crumbles to the mud. +e ee OF  79.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: ...Please. I just want to talk! RAMBO, DIAZ and SARAH slip behind the huts. SARAH hears ARTHUR’S desperate voice.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: It’s Reverend Marsh.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: (yells) Stop! Please stop! There’s been enough killing, I just want them and we’ll go. You’re not savages, there doesn’t need to be anymore killing - Please let me take them to their families!! They deserve that - Everyone’s suffered enough! SARAH'S legs nearly buckle at the realization.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: They’11 kill him -

dialogues.speaker: DIAZ
dialogues.text: - Stupid bastard.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Where are the rest?

dialogues.speaker: RAMBO
dialogues.text: Dead. RAMBO nods and she slumps against his shoulder. ARTHUR, though terrified, musters up the will to hold his body and mind together.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: If you’re in charge - We can talk this out!! - We can! We’re not that different. TINT parts the crowd and glares into the man’s face.

dialogues.speaker: TINT
dialogues.text: (in Burmese) Who the fuck is this?

dialogues.speaker: LT. AYE
dialogues.text: (in Burmese) Don’t know - Just walked in here -  80. TINT grabs a handful of ARTHUR’S hair and snaps his head back.

dialogues.speaker: TINT
dialogues.text: Any more of you out there?! Any more ‘Americans’? TINT gestures towards he surrounding jungle. TINT (CONT’D) Tell me or I’11 cut you in pieces! ! TINT savagely beats ARTHUR to the ground. TINT (CONT’D) Anymore with you? Last time I ask!? (again he gestures toward the jungle)

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: I just want to take them home - At his limit, TINT barks an order to LT. AYE and ARTHUR is hoisted to his feet and shoved roughly towards the rear of the compound. ARTHUR (CONT’D) You don’t have to do this! - We’ll leave! RAMBO pulls SARAH away as the troops approach. ARTHUR (CONT’D) We just want to leave - We were wrong! We were - A punch to the lower back silences the man. As TROOPS drag ARTHUR to the PIG PENS, the vile hogs unnerving grunts can be heard rising in anticipation. RAMBO and DIAZ lead SARAH behind another hootch as ARTHUR is dragged past. RAMBO roughly grabs her by the shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: RAMBO
dialogues.text: ...The perimeter’s probably mined beyond the punji sticks, but you two gotta try to get through it - No choice.

dialogues.speaker: RAMBO
dialogues.text: Don’t worry, I’1l1 be alright They move off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TROOPS and ARTHUR arrive at the disgusting site. Automatically FOUR TROOPS muscle past the pigs and quickly cut down the dead missionary. As the corpse crumbles to the muck, ARTHUR is bound to the pole. Satisfied, TINT barks an order and two troops run to the HUT to retrieve SARAH.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Please it was a mistake - Please, oh God, help me!!... (he silently prays) The two troops rush out of the SOLDIER’S HUT yelling that SARAH is missing! Enraged, TINT yells for LT. AYE to blow ARTHUR’S brains out. LT. AYE places a pistol against ARTHUR’S temple and prepares to pull the trigger. On LT. AYE. In the blink of an eye we hear a thunderous explosion and the soldier’s head is transformed into a cloud of red mist and fragments. RAMBO is positioned behind the incredibly destructive machine gun that is bolted on the rear of TINT'S army Jeep. FIVE other troops are ripped to shreds by the massive bullets as they attempt to retaliate. TINT runs for his life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DIAZ tosses a GRENADE into the BAMBOO PUNJI sticks, clearing a passageway.  137 138 139 140 82. Once done, he begins to carefully move SARAH through the jagged maze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fleeing for their lives, the TROOPS attempt to seek cover behind any object, but it’s to no avail as the lethal .50 Cal. Ordnance rips them apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LEWIS steps from behind a hut and takes out THREE TROOPERS who were charging towards RAMBO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAMBO takes aim at the FUEL DUMP as the troops flee into that area. The murderous gun ignites the FUEL creating a wide concussive explosion that covers men in a molten blanket of death. A massive river of flame cascades down the hill, igniting the base of the GUARD TOWER. Three other TROOP TRUCKS are igniting the base of the GUARD TOWER. It’s DENSE SMOKE creates a very obscure view of RAMBO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAMBO then turns the weapon at the MUNITIONS TENT. Flaming tracers bore into the stockpile of bombs and grenades, causing them to erupt in a huge fireball. Hundreds of heated bullets fly in every direction. Several TROOPS are killed by the exploding ammo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TINT seeks safety beside one of the huts and glares at RAMBO with undiluted hatred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LEWIS cuts down two more TROOPERS charging towards RAMBO. Once done he sprints to another location.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DIAZ and SARAH are twenty yards into the jungle when the light from the guard tower illuminates them. They’re milliseconds away from death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAMBO takes aim at one GUARD TOWER and the upper portion is reduced to splinters likewise the GUARD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DIAZ is leading the way when he suddenly steps on A MINE and is killed instantly. Panicking, SARAH rushes back towards RAMBO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the light from the SECOND GUARD TOWER attempts to search out RAMBO, LEWIS takes dead aim kills the GUARD and the light tilts awkwardly skyward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two more TROOPS take hits from RAMBO and the AMMO on the .50 Caliber is exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: He’s dead!! - He stepped on a mine!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LEWIS spies two TROOPS trying to flank RAMBO’S position and takes them out. He too is out of ammo and now the situation is hopeless. Ducking behind a hut, we see the futility of it all in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAMBO attempts to belly crawl back to the whole in the PUNJI STICKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now with the 50 CAL MACHINE GUN empty, the compound has become eerily quiet. The only sound is the rain and the yelling back and forth of several TROOPS as they carefully stalk closer to RAMBO’S position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAMBO pauses and looks out onto the black surrounding. In the distance the outlines of soldiers moving cautiously forward are everywhere. RAMBO realizes there is no escaping this. He looks at SARAH who looks into his eyes searching for one glimpse of hope. There is none.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: ...I/m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: RAMBO
dialogues.text: No. +e ee OF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 152 153 154 155 85. RAMBO gently brushes aside the rain that cascades into her eyes, then sighing, prepares to rise. SARAH grabs his hand.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: RAMBO
dialogues.text: Maybe it’1ll buy some time. It’s alright. This is my church. He rises with his hands held empty at his side.

dialogues.speaker: TROOPS
dialogues.text: With the waning flames behind the approaching soldiers, the vision is a true precursor to hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TINT steps into view.

dialogues.speaker: TINT
dialogues.text: I want him alive! I want him alive!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LEWIS watches in dismay. TROOPS pass fairly close to him. A RIFLE laying in the hand of a DEAD SOLDIER is just out of reach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SARAH watches as the soldiers close the circle and TINT approaches, murder in his eyes.  156 157 158 159 160 86. Suddenly a RED DOT appears on the soldier’s chest closest to RAMBO and a millisecond later a SNIPER’S bullet savagely rips into his body. The SECOND SOLDIER is also instantly blown away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAMBO’S eyes flash in the direction of bright tracers, he then dives back and grabs SARAH pulling her to the ARMORED VEHICLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two more charging TROOPS are nailed by the SNIPER. The thirty-five remaining troops panic and fire into the direction of the sniper fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LEWIS sprints to a dead soldier, takes his weapon and heads toward RAMBO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As we hear random bullets and see tracers chewing up real estate around SCHOOL BOY’S position, the young sniper appears unfazed. He steadies his rifle on the tree branch and continues to smoothly fire away creating havoc down below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAMBO puts SARAH into the armored Jeep and fires it up. LEWIS runs up to RAMBO who’s shocked to see him. + ee OF  161 162 163 164 165

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS
dialogues.text: Let’s get the fuck outta here!! RAMBO speeds towards the gate while LEWIS lays cover fire. 87.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 161 TINT fires his pistol - bullets ricochet off the machine.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 162 The SOLDIERS that attempt to shoot the fleeing Americans are targeted by the sniper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On SCHOOL BOY. The young man still remains cool under fire and with a watchmakers precision, nails TROOPS EVEN as they run full stride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAMBO, SARAH and LEWIS are BARRELLING towards the Main gate as troops at the far end of the camp fires at the Jeep. LEWIS is hit in the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scope’s CROSS HAIRS settle across on the TROOPER who shot LEWIS. SCHOOL BOY’S finger gently squeezes the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TROOPER is blown into permanent slumber by a .419 grain slug that deposits a fist-size hole in his chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Jeep’s RADIATOR is punctured and an enemy bullet blows out one of the front tires. Still the riddled machine grinds through the debris as LEWIS lays down cover fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TINT is bellowing orders to the battle-shocked troops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAMBO guides the smoking machine onto the rutted jungle road. The burning compound shrinks in the background. SCHOOL BOY jumps out of the growth and is illuminated by the Jeep’s headlight LEWIS holds his bloody shoulder as SCHOOL BOY piles in the smoking Jeep, which speeds off into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TINT and twenty-five troops pour out of the compound, double-timing it up the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the rain lightens up, the JEEP’S ENGINE finally bursts into FIRE. Small flames leak from beneath the boiling hood. RAMBO whips the Jeep to the side and they pile out. 88. 166 167 168 169 170 171  172 173 174 175 176 177

dialogues.speaker: RAMBO
dialogues.text: This way!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STEAMING FOREST is coming alive with the sounds of nature as the fog begins to lift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TINT and his troops approach the SMOULDERING JEEP which has been reduced to a blackened shell. The dogs and the handlers are jogging to the area. TINT orders them to split up, then get on the WALKIE-TALKIE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAMBO, SARAH, LEWIS and SCHOOL BOY race through the shaded terrain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Troops have spread out and are searching, following the same trails as RAMBO and company.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAMBO, LEWIS, SCHOOL BOY and SARAH trudge through the muddy area. In the distance they hear TRACKING DOGS barking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They arrive at the CAVES RAMBO passed on the way in. The EIGHT KAREN OCCUPANTS see the bloody and bruised Americans and flee into the forest

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TINT'S troops continue to search the rugged jungle. The TRACKING DOG is picking up the pace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SARAH, LEWIS and SCHOOL BOY are half in a CAVE’S ENTRANCE.

dialogues.speaker: RAMBO
dialogues.text: (to LEWIS) Keep going southeast till ya hit the river - It’s maybe three or four klicks. If I can I’1l meet you down the river. (to School Boy) I need you to stay back.

dialogues.speaker: SCHOOL BOY
dialogues.text: I’m here. RAMBO almost gently tears the lower portion of SARAH’S blouse.

dialogues.speaker: RAMBO
dialogues.text: We need a diversion, the dogs will be following your scent - let them follow me. (he ties the strip of blouse around his ankle) You should be able to make it in three hours. (to LEWIS) How ya doin’?

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS
dialogues.text: (touches his wound) Alright. LEWIS holds his wounded shoulder. RAMBO grabs his arm.

dialogues.speaker: RAMBO
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS
dialogues.text: Ya owe me. ee RO

dialogues.speaker: RAMBO
dialogues.text: (nods) Stay together no matter what, get her back, understand?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Why can’t we all go together? I got you into this.

dialogues.speaker: RAMBO
dialogues.text: No you didn’t. You gotta go - see you at the river. She hugs him with great tenderness. Though brief, he savors the moment, a fleeting instant of rare human contact. RAMBO (CONT’D) .Go. They move off.

dialogues.speaker: SCHOOL BOY
dialogues.text: What’s the plan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see FIVE SOLDIERS following the dog and his handler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TINT and TEN MEN pause on the WIDE TRAIL as a TROOP TRUCK arrives and THIRTY more fresh SOLDIERS pile out. TINT gestures to the COMPANY LEADER to head towards the river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LEWIS and SARAH move rapidly up the small stream bed. 91. 180 181 182 + ee OF + ee OF  183 184 185 186 187 188 92.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Running through the jungle, he pauses when he hears the dogs, then speeds away, moving gracefully through the growth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAMBO removes thin FISHING LINE from his side pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCHOOL BOY drops to one knee, studies an intended target in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DOG HANDLER’S animal’s progress is halted as SARAH’S scent is identified. Emitting a howl of recognition, the beast takes off in a ninety- degree angle.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. - SNIPER’S AREA 187 SCHOOL BOY studies the computer read out, then opens the tripod legs of the rifle and sinks into position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clouds are darkening above the forest’s double canopy. A Burmese scouting party led by one TRACKING DOG approaches the area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAMBO is seen climbing out of the caves ascending the towering slope as the troops are seen approaching below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The howling dog rushes into the caves. The lead soldier hits the hidden fishing line which is connected to three GRENADES at head height. The explosion levels two men, and two others are blown from the cave’s opening. One BURMESE TROOPER tries to help his COMRADE in the tunnel and is suddenly blown off his feet by a sniper round. The bullet’s velocity is so extreme it passes through the SOLDIER and carves out a large hunk of rock directly behind him.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. - SNIPER’S AREA - DAY 191 SCHOOL BOY coolly swings the sight around and fires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SECOND TROOPER is cut down. The bullet passes through him and severs the trunk of a small tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCHOOL BOY lowers the sniper rifle and dashes from sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see SARAH and LEWIS rushing towards the river. SARAH is exhausted as LEWIS helps her along. His bleeding’s getting worse. x %  195 196 197 198 199 94.

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS
dialogues.text: You wanna live, move it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TINT and his group of twenty troopers head in the direction of the explosion. He then pauses and picks up the walkie-talkie.

dialogues.speaker: TINT
dialogues.text: ...DO you read?! Come in!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAMBO runs along the jungle path.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCHOOL BOY pours it on as his strength is pushed to the limit climbing up to a very steep ridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TRACKING DOG and a group of TEN SOLDIERS pick up SARAH’S scent and charge off in that direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SARAH and LEWIS reach a steep embankment. LEWIS Checks the compasses and they speed off down a treacherous embankment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Following tugging TRACKING DOG, the BURMESE TROOPERS continue to close ground on RAMBO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Traveling down a WINDING PATH he sprints past the WATERFALL they passed on the way in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The LONGBOAT is motoring along the shoreline to the designated extraction point.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 203 The tracking DOG and TROOPS are hot on RAMBO’S tail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pouring sweat, SCHOOL BOY reaches the HIGH GROUND VANTAGE POINT. He looks through the scope. He barely sees the outline of the TALL BOY BOMB 1800 yards away. With his scraped up hands, he commences to punching in information into the small computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LEWIS and SARAH run along the fringes of the burnt- out village and past the lethally mined rice paddy. 204 205

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAMBO running from the area near the TALL BOY BOMB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCHOOL BOY swings the scope almost imperceptably to the left. Through the lens we see an EXTREME CLOSE of RAMBO running away from the BOMB. Panning the scope back, he sees the TROOPS and TRACKING DOG arrive at the BOMB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TRACKING DOG tugs wildly as they are hot on RAMBO’S scent. They suddenly pull up short and frantically circle, then begin HOWLING at a MASSIVE object. The troopers stare at the decrepid vine-covered unexploded 12,000 POUND TALLBOY BOMB. The dog paws wildly at an area near the nose of the bomb. A TROOPER reaches into a slight indentation in the earth near the front of the bomb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAMBO still running away from the bomb area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the scope, SCHOOL BOY studies RAMBO running then back to the BOMB then back to RAMBO...He’s too close to detonate it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TROOPER holds up the PIECE of SARAH’S BLOUSE that was tied to RAMBO’S ankle. He yells at his fellow TROOPERS and angrily throws the CLOTH to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Panting, RAMBO pulls up and stares hard at the ridge line.

dialogues.speaker: RAMBO
dialogues.text: (to himself) »..Shoot! He runs off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCHOOL BOY studies RAMBO through the scope.

dialogues.speaker: SCHOOL BOY
dialogues.text: Move man, move! C’mon! He pans back to the TROOPS who are beginning to move off. He pans back to RAMBO. SCHOOL BOY (CONT’D) ...A little more, a little more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAMBO angrily looks up at the ridge line as he runs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCHOOL BOY watches RAMBO pass to a safe distance away.

dialogues.speaker: SCHOOL BOY
dialogues.text: Acceptable.  216 217 218 219 98. The SCOPE’S CROSS HAIRS center on the BOMB. He fires and the slug hits the metal monster at supersonic speed, ringing out sharply in the silent jungle. Nothing. No_ explosion. The TROOPERS freeze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TROOPS drop to the ground and begin to fire wildly in the direction they believe the shot emanated from. Another bullet loudly gouges the bomb’s corroded metal casing. STILL NO EXPLOSION!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCHOOL BOY is now showing signs of anxiety.

dialogues.speaker: SCHOOL BOY
dialogues.text: C’mon -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another crack of the SNIPER’S RIFLE is heard, and again the loud metallic clang of an armor piercing bullet ripping into the ancient BOMB reverberates around the soldiers. Nothing. The TROOPS now realize what SCHOOL BOY’S attempting to do and yell to run for their lives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCHOOL BOY wipes the sweat from his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: SCHOOL BOY
dialogues.text: ...Wake the fuck up, Frankenstein! He fires.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: ee

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The screaming bullet bores into the BOMB and the Massive monster finally roars to life and explodes with COLOSSAL FORCE! Trees snap in half for a hundred yards in every direction. Nearly every TROOPER is blown into dust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAMBO, still running, pauses upon hearing the hellish explosion. Suddenly, behind him, a hot wind kicks up and a massive BOILING CLOUD of dust and dirt rushes toward him. He huddles behind the base of a tree as the remnants of the explosion roar past like a deadly express train.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SARAH and LEWIS are stopped cold by the THUNDEROUS explosion.

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS
dialogues.text: Come on! SARAH'S expression drains as she presumes RAMBO’S dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TINT and his troops whip around upon hearing the incredible roar. He yells into his walkie-talkie. NO RESPONSE. He commands his men to continue towards the river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small seven-man BURMESE PATROL BOAT is alerted by the explosion. +e ee OF  225 226 227 228 229 They see a towering plume of smoke and dust rising a mile inland. They turn and speed off in the direction of the blast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The LONGBOAT is waiting. They’ve also heard the explosion. The pair of SNAKE CATCHERS exchange nervous glances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LEWIS and SARAH close in on the river’s edge... LEWIS is bleeding badly. SARAH attempts to help pull him along. He pushes her hand aside and swells with indignation.

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS
dialogues.text: (fading) ...I help you. C’mon! He pulls her along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BURMESE TROOPS with TINT are shortening the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAMBO is rushing through the jungle toward the river’s edge, TOTALLY EXHAUSTED, he momentarily drops to one knee. He wearily rises and continues.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 229 SCHOOL BOY cradles his weapon as he rushes to the river +e OF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On board the LONGBOAT, the SNAKE CATCHERS see SARAH and LEWIS approaching in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LEWIS and SARAH are a hundred-and-fifty yards away from the LONGBOAT when suddenly the crack of a rifle is heard. The branches ten feet to the right of LEWIS break off! They jump behind a tree.

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS
dialogues.text: (exhausted) Go - Go - Go! More rifle shots are heard as the bullets begin whipping past them. LEWIS roughly shoves her.

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (explodes) Go!! SARAH gently touches his arm, then runs off.

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Stay low God damn it! Turning, he raises the RIFLE to his bloody shoulder and lays down cover fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TINT and his company of thirty troops appear. They fire at the fleeing woman - Only the DENSE GROWTH saves her. LEWIS continues to lay down COVER FIRE as best he can and TINT’S TROOPS are momentarily stopped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exhausted SARAH runs and stumbles her way to the boat. A SNAKE HUNTER jumps in the river to assist her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TINT bellows for his troops to continue forward! Suddenly GUNFIRE erupts from the troops flank - SEVERAL TROOPS DIE IN THEIR TRACKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FORTY KAREN REBELS burst out of the undergrowth. The rag-tag rebels unleash all their firepower from their vastly inferior rifles. We clearly see the KAREN GUIDE, MYINT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With his strength waning fast, LEWIS puts in his final CLIP and fires at TINT’S TROOPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAMBO runs towards the FIRE-FIGHT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCHOOL BOY comes into view and runs towards the KAREN REBEL side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TINT orders his men to battle harder! They do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SNAKE CATCHERS help the exhausted SARAH on board. She collapses onto the deck. Several bullets hit the side of the LONGBOAT. The SNAKE CATCHERS panic, and shove the boat into gear. They begin to pull out

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Where’re you going!? You can’t leave without them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCHOOL BOY joins the ranks of the Karen and using his superior weapon, begins picking off BURMESE TROOPERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the Burmese hit by SCHOOL BOY’S AMMO again. The BULLETS pass through them and carve chunks out of the surrounding trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In full out warrior mode, RAMBO charges up behind the nearest BURMESE SOLDIER and impales him with his KNIFE. In all the noisy confusion, no other soldier notices RAMBO’S presence. He moves swiftly to the next soldier then the next.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SARAH rushes to the SNAKE CATCHER at the helm.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: We can’t leave! Wait for him! Wait! She tries to take the RUDDER HANDLE away from the SNAKE CATCHER. SARAH (CONT’D) We have to leave together! wWe’re leaving together! He pushes her to the floor where she lays exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LEWIS’ gun is empty.

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS
dialogues.text: ...Run you son of a bitch. Casting it aside, he summons his last remaining strength and unsteadily tries to reach the departing boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TINT sees this and aims at LEWIS’ back.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: A deadly AUTO BURST shreds LEWIS’ back with hot lead. SARAH screams at the sight of LEWIS crumbling. He locks eyes with her and dies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAMBO, having witnessed this, charges TINT with reckless abandon. TINT whips around and a split second before he can pull the trigger, RAMBO’S bloodied KNIFE slashes through his neck. RAMBO’S momentum sends him crashing to the ground. Exhausted, he raises his eye only to see TINT’S headless body slowly crumbling to the earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BURMESE NAVY BOAT suddenly appears around the bend and opens fire on the LONGBOAT. The top of the LONGBOAT is shredded into SPLINTERS by the PATROL BOAT’S front- mounted MACHINE GUN. The SNAKE CATCHERS are instantly killed. Rapid gunfire continues to shred the wood inches above SARAH’S head. The BURMESE GUN BOAT now turns and OPEN FIRES on the REBELS. The boat also fires a huge stream of fire from it’s mounted FLAME THROWER. (Often used to clear away undergrowth where the enemy may hide.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAMBO rises and feels his heart sink assuming SARAH has been killed. He snatches up a DEAD SOLDIER’S RIFLE and aims before he can pull the trigger the loud crack of a rifle shot coming from the opposite direction is heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BURMESE SAILOR is blown off the boat.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: + ee OF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming into view is an 80 FT MILITARY BOAT painted in black. On deck are SIX SPECIAL FORCES TROOPS. The large craft let’s loose with it’s BIG GUNS and the BURMESE VESSEL is blown completely out of the water. A moment later, BUMGARDENER steps into view and nods to the SPECIAL FORCES MEN for a job well done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAMBO stares hard at the figure of BUMGARDENER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCHOOL BOY steps into view as the KAREN REBELS now chase the dispirited BURMESE TROOPS deeper into the jungle.

dialogues.speaker: BUMGARDENER
dialogues.text: We’re here to officially escort you and whoever you’re with, back into Thai waters - Whoever is with you must come with us now! SARAH rises and jumps over the side and wades towards RAMBO. He approaches her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BUMGARDENER motions to the TEAM LEADER.

dialogues.speaker: BUMGARDENER
dialogues.text: Enough bullshit - Get close and pick ‘em up. + ee OF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 256 257 258 107. The vessel swings to shore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCHOOL BOY lowers his weapon. He bends over LEWIS’ body. LEWIS is on his last breath.

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS
dialogues.text: She make it?

dialogues.speaker: SCHOOL BOY
dialogues.text: You got her here.

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS
dialogues.text: ...Was I a good man? LEWIS exhales his last breath and dies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SARAH and RAMBO meet half way and with tears of joy and exhaustion she embraces the battered warrior. RAMBO’S arms remain immobile and SARAH looks into his eyes questioningly. He finally enfolds her in his arms. The scene dissolves to the exterior main airport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Large crowds rush to and fro along the massive corridors. RAMBO stands at the BOARDING GATE with SARAH. He stares hard at her, as if trying to find words to express himself.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: ...What are you thinkin’?

dialogues.speaker: RAMBO
dialogues.text: It’s nothin’ -

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: ...I don’t have to leave. eee  108.

dialogues.speaker: RAMBO
dialogues.text: (sighs) ...You do - you have a good life waitin’ for you. He hands her the COBRA PEARL.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: ...Thank you - Will I ever see you again?

dialogues.speaker: RAMBO
dialogues.text: Anything’s possible.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: (hugs him) ...I’11 miss you. RAMBO hugs her back and she starts off towards the BOARDING GATE. RAMBO’S pensive expression follows until she takes one final glance and passes from view. RAMBO turns and crosses to BUMGARDENER and SCHOOL BOY waiting across the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: BUMGARDENER
dialogues.text: Ya alright? - I mean, you’re not getting emotional now? RAMBO stiffens and SCHOOL BOY smiles.

dialogues.speaker: SCHOOL BOY
dialogues.text: I’m gettin’ out of the way. The camera begins to crane up.

dialogues.speaker: BUMGARDENER
dialogues.text: No, John’s got a solid sense of humor - anyone can see that. RAMBO’S stern expression breaks into a reluctant smile. The men move off and blend into the CROWD as the camera continues to climb. BUMGARDENER (CONT’D) I have a few things to kick around with you. The camera continues to crane up as RAMBO, SCHOOL BOY and BUMGARDENER melt into the TRAVELERS. BUMGARDENER (CONT’D) Are you both hungry? + ee OF

dialogues.speaker: RAMBO
dialogues.text: A little.

dialogues.speaker: BUMGARDENER
dialogues.text: Good. Let’s go to that place where the food doesn’t look back at you....
